00006 #define MAX_PROGRESSBARS 4

00009 {
00010       UINT8 ubProgressBarID;

00030 extern PROGRESSBAR *pBar[ MAX_PROGRESSBARS ];

00032 void CreateLoadingScreenProgressBar();
00033 void RemoveLoadingScreenProgressBar();

00036 //This creates a single progress bar given the coordinates without a panel (containing a title and background).
00037 //A panel is automatically created if you specify a title using SetProgressBarTitle
00038 BOOLEAN CreateProgressBar( UINT8 ubProgressBarID, UINT16 usLeft, UINT16 usTop, UINT16 usRight, UINT16 usBottom );
00039 
00040 //You may also define a panel to go in behind the progress bar.  You can now assign a title to go with
00041 //the panel.
00042 void DefineProgressBarPanel( UINT32 ubID, UINT8 r, UINT8 g, UINT8 b,
00043                                                                                      UINT16 usLeft, UINT16 usTop, UINT16 usRight, UINT16 usBottom );
00044 
00045 //Assigning a title for the panel will automatically position the text horizontally centered on the
00046 //panel and vertically centered from the top of the panel, to the top of the progress bar.
00047 void SetProgressBarTitle( UINT32 ubID, UINT16 *pString, UINT32 usFont, UINT8 ubForeColor, UINT8 ubShadowColor );
00048 
00049 //Unless you set up the attributes, any text you pass to SetRelativeStartAndEndPercentage will
00050 //default to FONT12POINT1 in a black color.
00051 void SetProgressBarMsgAttributes( UINT32 ubID, UINT32 usFont, UINT8 ubForeColor, UINT8 ubShadowColor );
00052 
00053 
00054 //When finished, the progress bar needs to be removed.
00055 void RemoveProgressBar( UINT8 ubID );
00056 
00057 //An important setup function.  The best explanation is through example.  The example being the loading
00058 //of a file -- there are many stages of the map loading.  In JA2, the first step is to load the tileset.
00059 //Because it is a large chunk of the total loading of the map, we may gauge that it takes up 30% of the
00060 //total load.  Because it is also at the beginning, we would pass in the arguments ( 0, 30, "text" ).
00061 //As the process animates using UpdateProgressBar( 0 to 100 ), the total progress bar will only reach 30%
00062 //at the 100% mark within UpdateProgressBar.  At that time, you would go onto the next step, resetting the
00063 //relative start and end percentage from 30 to whatever, until your done.
00064 void SetRelativeStartAndEndPercentage( UINT8 ubID, UINT32 uiRelStartPerc, UINT32 uiRelEndPerc, UINT16 *str);
00065 
00066 //This part renders the progress bar at the percentage level that you specify.  If you have set relative
00067 //percentage values in the above function, then the uiPercentage will be reflected based off of the relative
00068 //percentages.  
00069 void RenderProgressBar( UINT8 ubID, UINT32 uiPercentage );
00070 
00071 
00072 //Sets the color of the progress bars main color.
00073 void SetProgressBarColor( UINT8 ubID, UINT8 ubColorFillRed, UINT8 ubColorFillGreen, UINT8 ubColorFillBlue );
00074 
00075 //Pass in TRUE to display the strings.
00076 void SetProgressBarTextDisplayFlag( UINT8 ubID, BOOLEAN fDisplayText, BOOLEAN fUseSaveBuffer, BOOLEAN fSaveScreenToFrameBuffer );
00077
